TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., The Austin Papers, (Austin: University of Texas Press, 1927), 3 vols., Vol 3, pp. 452-453
TEI.2.document_title: James Collinsworth to Stephen F Austin, 11-08-1836

barker_notes.barker_summary: Satisfied that annexation may take place at once
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., The Austin Papers, (Austin: University of Texas Press, 1927), 3 vols., Vol 3, pp. 452-453

div1.p: Satisfied that annexation may take place at once
I am satisfied that an Union of Texas with the U States may take place this winter upon the following basis. The Gov. of the U. States to assume our debts to endow liberally Academic Colleges etc.
The object of the U. States is the jurisdiction over the soil, its value is of no object to them.
But no legislation or private Claims will under any circumstances be admitted. All Claims must be settled according to the laws under which they were acquired
